result.execSummary:
The defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA  surcharge,  all other costs fees surcharges and assessments during term of probation on counts 9 and 11; or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample if not already provided.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: AS TO COUNTS NINE AND 11, each count consecutive and consecutive to count one.
The Court does not impose any condition time and if any violations, the defendant should be revoked.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees  as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or  other means.  Any bail to be applied.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medication(s) and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

No contact with the victim unless requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the Court.
No contact with firearms.
No new law violations.

Attend and successfully complete anger management and continued programming.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
All costs, fees, assessmetns and surcharges as to count one are to be paid during this period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: AS STATED IN COUNT 7.

miscConds.notes: Conditions as listed on count seven.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ajani Akil Ferrell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense, defendant and Arnetta P.
AS to count 1: 
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 105 days time served.    
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already provided, and pay the DNA fees and surcharges, and to pay all other costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation imposed in counts 9 and 11, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
AS to counts 9 and 11:
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, each count, consecutive and consecutive to count 1, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months, concurrent.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
THE COURT DOES NOT IMPOSE ANY CONDITION TIME AND IF ANY VIOLATIONS THE DEFENDANT SHOULD BE REVOKED.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-All costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as to count 1 are to be paid during this period of probation; failure to pay will result in civil judgment..
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; 
Defendant remanded.

Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have resolved this matter.  The defendant will be entering guilty pleas to counts 1, 9, and 11.
Pursuant to negotiations the court will order counts 2 thru 8 and 10 dismissed and read in for sentencing.
AS TO COUNTS 1,9, 11:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Defendant is ordered remanded pending sentencing on 9-16-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance is waived.
Speedy trial stands for 8-24-2015.  State has filed its documents:  Witness List, Jury Instructions and Motion in Limine

Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Final Pretrial. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests and absoluste sobriety.  ABSOLUTELY NO RELEASE FROM HOME), 24 HOUR CURFEW).  
Release for legal contacts and court.   

** COURT ORDERED CASH BAIL REDUCED TO $1,000.00 (ONLY), if defendant is accepted on gps supervision.  If defendant is not accepted on gps supervision, BAIL REMAINS AT $1,500.00.   mld

Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  The Court modified bail to $1,000.00 cash ONLY, if defendant is accepted for gps supervision, and if not accepted, bail remains at $1,500.00.   mld

Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for Peter Tempelis for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Anna Busch.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer letter will need to be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-11-2015 at 8:15 am and Jury Trial on 8-24-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Exhibit 1 withdrawn by the State.   mld

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Upon the request of defense counsel, Preliminary Hearing adjourned to Branch 4 on 6-26-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in custody.  Elizabeth Longo for Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is requesting an adjournment, officer is not present for today's proceedings.  Defense Counsel does not object to an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch 04.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred to Prelim Court for the Preliminary Hearing.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Carlecia S.; Deanna D or Tamara M

Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Ajani Akil Ferrell in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 11.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
